00001 /*
00002  * gxrm.c -- the body of the program.
00003  *
00004  *       The GNU xrm program is a program which prints a
00005  *       random message each time you run it (X version).
00006  *
00007  *       However, it supports some useful options.
00008  *
00009  *       See Texinfo manual page for more information.
00010  *
00011  * Copyright (C) 2006 Efstathios Chatzikyriakidis (stathis.chatzikyriakidis@gmail.com)
00012  *
00013  * This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
00014  * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
00015  * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or
00016  * (at your option) any later version.
00017  *
00018  * This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
00019  * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00020  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
00021  * GNU General Public License for more details.
00022  *
00023  * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
00024  * along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software
00025  * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301 USA
00026  *
00027  */

00029 /* standard includes. */
00030 #include <gtk/gtk.h>
00031 #include <getopt.h>
00032 #include <stdio.h>
00033 #include <stdlib.h>
00034 #include <string.h>
00035 #include <unistd.h>
00036 
00037 /* my includes. */
00038 #include "program_typedefs.h"
00039 #include "program_messages.h"
00040 
00041 /* local defines. */
00042 #define MAX_LINE (1024 * 1024)  /* 1 Mbyte. */
00043 
00044 /* global variables. */
00045 static const char *input_filename = NULL;
00046 static const char *program_name = NULL;
00047 
00048 /* externs. */
00049 extern char *strdup (const char *);
00050 extern char *stpcpy (char *, const char *);
00051 extern FILE *popen (const char *, const char *);
00052 extern int pclose (FILE *);
00053 
00054 /* the name of the executable only. */
00055 extern char *program_invocation_short_name;
00056 
00057 /* function prototypes. */
00058 static void parse_options (int, char **);
00059 static void print_usage (FILE *, cint);
00060 
00061 /* functions. */
00062 /* the body of the program. */
00063 int
00064 main (int argc, char *argv[])
00065 {
00066   /* the reading pipe edge. */
00067   FILE *pipe_stream = NULL;
00068 
00069   /* the window and the label which has the message. */
00070   GtkWidget *window = NULL;
00071   GtkWidget *label = NULL;
00072 
00073   /* any error produced? */
00074   bool error = false;
00075 
00076   /* current line of chars. */
00077   char sentence[MAX_LINE] = { 0 };
00078 
00079   /* the command which fetches the sentences. */
00080   char comm_str[MAX_LINE] = { 0 };
00081 
00082   /* parse all input command line options. */
00083   parse_options (argc, argv);
00084 
00085   /* input file is necessary! */
00086   if (input_filename == NULL)
00087     print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00088 
00089   /* form the command. */
00090   stpcpy (stpcpy (comm_str, "gtrm -i "), input_filename);
00091 
00092   /* initialize gtk system. */
00093   gtk_init (&argc, &argv);
00094 
00095   /* create a window. */
00096   window = gtk_window_new (GTK_WINDOW_TOPLEVEL);
00097 
00098   /* set some attributes for the window. */
00099   gtk_window_set_title (GTK_WINDOW (window), "GNU X random message (gxrm)");
00100   gtk_window_set_position (GTK_WINDOW (window), GTK_WIN_POS_CENTER);
00101   gtk_window_set_default_size (GTK_WINDOW (window), 240, 35);
00102   g_signal_connect (G_OBJECT (window), "destroy", gtk_main_quit, NULL);
00103 
00104   /* start piping. */
00105   pipe_stream = popen (comm_str, "r");
00106 
00107   /* start reading. */
00108 
00109   /* check to see if there is a problem. */
00110   if (fgets (sentence, MAX_LINE, pipe_stream) == NULL)
00111     {
00112       label = gtk_label_new (found_problem);
00113       error = true;
00114     }
00115   else
00116     {
00117       /* give some space on left and right. */
00118       char *sentence_fixed = (char *) malloc (strlen (sentence) + 1 + 10);
00119 
00120       strcpy (sentence_fixed, "   ");
00121       strcat (sentence_fixed, sentence);
00122       sentence_fixed[strlen (sentence_fixed) - 1] = '\0';
00123       strcat (sentence_fixed, "   ");
00124 
00125       label = gtk_label_new (sentence_fixed);
00126 
00127       free (sentence_fixed);
00128     }
00129 
00130   /* show the window with the message. */
00131   gtk_container_add (GTK_CONTAINER (window), label);
00132   gtk_widget_show_all (window);
00133   gtk_main ();
00134 
00135   /* close piping. */
00136   pclose (pipe_stream);
00137 
00138   return error ? EXIT_FAILURE : EXIT_SUCCESS;
00139 }
00140 
00141 /* the following function prints some
00142    usage information for the program. */
00143 static void
00144 print_usage (FILE * stream, cint exit_code)
00145 {
00146   fprintf (stream, "%s %s %s\n", usage_part_a, program_name, usage_part_b);
00147   fprintf (stream, "\n%s\n", usage_part_c);
00148   fprintf (stream, "%s\n", reportbugs_msg);
00149   exit (exit_code);
00150 }
00151 
00152 /* the following function parses the command line. */
00153 static void
00154 parse_options (int argc, char **argv)
00155 {
00156   /* the next option. */
00157   register int next_option;
00158 
00159   /* both short and long options. */
00160   unique short_options = "i:";
00161   const struct option long_options[] = {
00162     {"input", 1, NULL, 'i'},
00163     {"help", 0, NULL, 'h'},
00164     {"usage", 0, NULL, 'u'},
00165     {"version", 0, NULL, 'V'},
00166     {NULL, 0, NULL, 0}
00167   };
00168 
00169   /* fetch program's name. */
00170   program_name = program_invocation_short_name;
00171 
00172   /* start scanning. */
00173   do
00174     {
00175       /* get next option. */
00176       next_option =
00177         getopt_long (argc, argv, short_options, long_options, NULL);
00178 
00179       switch (next_option)
00180         {
00181           /* print usage and exit. */
00182         case 'h':
00183         case 'u':
00184           print_usage (stdout, EXIT_SUCCESS);
00185 
00186           /* print version information and exit. */
00187         case 'V':
00188           printf ("%s %s\n", package_msg, version_msg);
00189           printf ("%s %s\n", writtenby_msg, developers_msg);
00190           printf ("\n%s", license_part_a);
00191           printf ("%s\n", license_part_b);
00192           printf ("%s\n", license_part_c);
00193           printf ("%s\n", reportbugs_msg);
00194           exit (EXIT_SUCCESS);
00195 
00196           /* get input filename. */
00197         case 'i':
00198           input_filename = strdup (optarg);
00199           break;
00200 
00201           /* unknown option. */
00202         case '?':
00203           print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00204 
00205         case -1:
00206           break;
00207 
00208         default:
00209           abort ();
00210         }
00211     }
00212   while (next_option != -1);
00213 }
